text.text_translated:
Genes are special parts in our body.
They tell our body what to do.
Scientists ask questions about genes.
They ask how genes help our brains.
They ask how genes help our language.
Did some genes have a small change?
Did this small change give us language?
Scientists found one gene.
This gene had a small change 200,000 to 100,000 years ago.
This small change seems to help us speak.
It seems to help our brains control our mouths and faces.
Monkeys have similar genes.
But their genes did not have this small change.
We do not know how much genes affect language.
It is too early to say.
But one day we might find answers in our DNA.

best_attempt.text_translated:
We have more questions about genes. We want to know how genes influence our brains. We want to know how genes influence our language. We want to know how they help our brains and language grow.
Did some genes change? Did this change give us language ability?
Researchers found a gene mutation. This mutation happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago.
This mutation seems to have a connection with speaking. It also helps our brains control our mouths and faces.
Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not get this mutation.
It is too early to say how much genes influence language. But one day we might find answers. The answers might be in our DNA.
